newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares seen rising despite French elections.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares seen rising despite French elections.

text.p: Danish share prices opened unchanged on Monday, with dealers seeing rises ahead after Friday's Dow rise due to expected solid buying interest despite the left-wing lead in the first round of the French elections.

"The French left-wing gains are negative for the markets but we could climb by up to a half percent here today on buyer interest provided the closed markets in London and New York do not put a damper on things," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index stood at an unchanged 166.36 point at 0705 gmt, having closed 0.44 point higher on Friday.
